questions.question: Which of the following phrases best describes the way that Miss Emily’s father treated her?

choices.answer: in a controlling way that limited her life
with a great deal of concern for her happiness
in an authoritarian yet kindly way

questions.question: Why do some townspeople avoid asking Miss Emily about the smell?

choices.answer: it is impossible to reach Miss Emily
the smell might come from somewhere else
they find it improper to tell her that she smells
they suspect that she committed murder

questions.question: Miss Emily’s attitude toward her taxes helps foreshadow her…

choices.answer: teaching of china painting to her neighbors
inability to keep up with riding costs
ignorance of other rules and conventions

questions.question: Which event actually happens firstin the sequence of Miss Emily’s life?

choices.answer: Miss Emily rides with Homer Barron
Townsmen place lime around the house

questions.question: The description of her house filled with “dust and shadows” after her death adds to the mood of
Why does Miss Emily stop giving china painting lessons?

choices.answer: Miss Emily’s kinsfolk persuade her to stop
The smell in her house chases students away
few people can afford to pay her high prices
students of the new generation stop attending

questions.question: A word that best sums up MissEmily’s attitude toward those who try to collect taxes from her is
The townspeople are curious about Miss Emily because she…

choices.answer: has a large house with many servants
refuses to leave her house later in life
had many suitors when she was young

questions.question: What was the construction company that employed Homer Barron doing in the town?
Who told Miss Emily she didn’t have to pay taxes?
Which event does the narrator describe first?

choices.answer: men put lime around Miss Emily’s house
Homer Barron returns after a brief absence
Miss Emily asks the druggist for some poison
two female cousins visit Miss Emily

questions.question: In this story, the narrator’s POV is most representative of the views and opinions held by…
Who lives with Miss Emily Grierson when she dies?
What does Miss Emily purchase from the druggist?
How does the description of Ms. Emily at death(gray hair, moldy pillow)add to the story's mood?

choices.answer: It indicates the feeling of joy surrounding her death.
It emphasizes the age and decay around her.
It creates a timeless sense of loss for the town.
It stresses the comfort and silence of death.
